alert.note: Alert for Darke; Miami; Montgomery; Preble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:11AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF PREBLE, SOUTHERN DARKE, MONTGOMERY AND MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 345 AM EST... At 311 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near New Paris, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Huber Heights, Troy, Trotwood, Piqua, Miamisburg, Vandalia, Englewood, Greenville, Tipp City, Eaton, Moraine, West Milton, Oakwood, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Covington, Arcanum and Camden. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 40. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 47 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
